The global surge of robotaxis, led by US and Chinese operators
subhead: From San Francisco and Shanghai to Abu Dhabi and soon London, projects and operational programs for fleets of autonomous vehicles are rapidly multiplying. In the race for innovation, American and Chinese tech giants have taken a commanding lead.
byline: By Blandine Berthe, Eric Béziat and Sophie Fay

title: Belgium resists unfreezing Russian assets held in Brussels
Canada lifts sanctions on Syria, following US
Germany introduces voluntary military service
subhead: Fourteen years after suspending mandatory military service, Germany plans to offer 18-year-olds the opportunity to undertake a voluntary military service lasting at least six months, with a monthly salary of €2,600.

title: In Haiti, a magistrate is accused of personally executing 'bandits'
subhead: The United Nations Integrated Office has directly implicated Jean Ernest Muscadin in the deaths of 28 people suspected of being gang members in southern Haiti. However, the government commissioner enjoys broad support from a population fed up with violence and government inaction.

title: Frank Gehry, one of the most famous contemporary architects, is dead
subhead: The first of a generation of star builders, his structures were a breath of fresh air, featuring curves and undulations like the Guggenheim Museum in Bilbao, the Walt Disney Concert Hall in Los Angeles and the Fondation Louis Vuitton in Paris. The American-Canadian died on December 5 at the age of 96.

title: Katherine Fleming and Los Angeles's Getty Center: A fortress of culture amid political turmoil
subhead: The president of the renowned arts institution on the West Coast, which withstood the wildfires earlier this year, seeks to further open the museum to the public.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (Los Angeles (United States), special correspondent)

Influential study on glyphosate safety retracted 25 years after publication
subhead: A 2000 study that concluded the well-known herbicide glyphosate was safe, widely cited since then, has just been officially disavowed by the journal that published it. The scientists are suspected of having signed a text actually prepared by Monsanto.

title: War in Ukraine: Europe finds itself sidelined and humiliated by the Trump administration
subhead: Steve Witkoff, the US president's special envoy, and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law, chose to meet the Ukrainian negotiators in Miami after canceling their Brussels stopover on their return from Moscow.
byline: By Elsa Conesa (Berlin (Germany), correspondent), Claire Gatinois and Philippe Jacqué (Brussels, Europe bureau)

title: 'With 'The American Revolution' series, director Ken Burns warns against the tendency to judge heroes of the past through the eyes of the present'
subhead: In a spectacular documentary, the filmmaker advocates for a nuanced and diverse understanding of the history of the American War of Independence against the British Crown – a perspective that does not sit well with all Republicans, explains Le Monde's Corine Lesnes.
